page.title: 11Royal Albert Hall
page.content: Since this is International Youth Year, Essex put on a spectacular show of what young people can do. The back- drop was an enormous map of the County made by the Primary schools and we did four sections showing Pentlow Tower, the school with a fox in front, Lyston Mill and so on. We used dye paint and ironed it when it was dry. Although it meant getting back very late Mr Finch took the Fourth Year in his car with Mrs Todd. We left at 4.0 and did a sightseeing tour - St Paul's Cathedral floodlit, The Embankment and Parliament Square. The show began 7.30 Our seats were near the organ and we never did see the map;they let it down and displayed art students' work after the interval! The show was fabulous - dancing, singing, bands, orchestra... For the return journey we were all put to sleep - except Mr Finch of course.
